{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question describes a situation where the number of acinar glands in the breast tissue of pregnant women has increased compared to non-pregnant women. This increase in the number of cells or tissues is referred to as hyperplasia. Hypertrophy refers to the increase in the size of cells, not their number. Atrophy refers to the decrease in the size or number of cells, which is not the case here. Metaplasia refers to the change in the type of cells, which is also not described in the scenario.", "answer_choice": "A"}
